comments.commentBody:
All you ever need to know about Dick Morris is summarized rather nicely by Jon Stewart at the 4:00 minute mark of this video.

http://www.thedailyshow.com...
I'm hoping Revis can be himself again. It's surprising that he didn't hire a personal trainer to keep himself in better shape during his holdout.
Thank you, everyone, for letting me know I screwed up. You're right; I do support those D's. They try to support the people, not the corporation.

"Obama Successes Outweighed by Job Losses"

Is that a news headline, or an Op-Ed headline?

That headline is begging for a cheap shot, on the order of "Obama Successes Outweighed by Feather."  The non-stimulus leading to the non-recovery is obviously very bad, but the so-called successes are making the situation worse.  The health care regulation bill, that mixture of bribery, chicane and economic nonsense (sure, we can cut costs and increase coverage at the same time) was rejected by three-fifths of the country.  Ted Kennedy's Senate seat went Republican  because of it, and those arrogant fools passed it anyway.  One more success like that and there won't be any Democratic Party.  As it is, it'll be put on a pretty severe diet.

The myth is that presidents' create jobs, which they do not other than those government positions developed by executive order. However, President Obama's first responsibility as CEO of USA was successful, he kept this badly listing ship of state afloat.
In addition to this flawed assumption by this author, he follows completely in the shoes of other reporters, who either does not know U.S. Civics or Capitalism.
Lt. Yevdokiya F. Utenkova for US President!

Reading the comments up to #46 - and the column - and The New York Times - one would think it's the president's fault.

It's not. Not really.

We have deflation. No economist alive understands deflation. And that's only part of it.

Americans are not what they used to be. The generation that survived the depression is largely gone. Their lessons are forgotten.

And the needed work ethic has vacated, as Washington has enabled. With reserve currency came the British disease.

We have met the enemy - it's we who are the enemy. Look in the mirror, America.

Read your pandering press. Blame it on the president.

Truth be known, David Leonhardt's analysis is correct - as far as it goes. It's not enough. Not too much.

But that is only part of it. Those who created this mess took charge of fixing. That was mistake #1. Huge.

Markets are broken. Wall Street is in total control. The games there have brought disaster to Main Street, and Main Street knows it.

Which is why the president is in trouble. He chose those who did it to fix it. He did not know where else to go. It's not his field.

It's not GOP vs. Democrat. There is no difference. Left - Right, mythology. Study what happened after IKE. Party did not matter.

When have we declared a war? What is a volunteer army? Why are we constantly at war?

The jobs went overseas. Why? We all know why. They work over there, and cost less.

Yet, we want to jack up cost in deflation. That is a physical impossibility. We can crush the currency - and give the same impression. But the goal is not right. It will not work. That dog won't hunt.

Contraction hurts. Deflation kills. Pushing on a string is a non-starter.

There are answers. They start with a statement of the problem. That requires honesty.

And common sense.

Honesty and common sense are two things not in oversupply.

No deflation there.

Everyone's on here arguing about whether it's the Democrats or the Republicans who did us in.  Meanwhile, the real culprits,  Wall Street, the Bankers, the Corporations, the War Profiteers are clapping their fat little hands and laughing at how easy it is to manipulate us.  Suckers.

I wish people would stop referring to ObamaCare, aka, The Insurance & Pharma Profits Protection Plan, as a huge legislative success.  Just this month the NYT ran a story on how insurance companies are now refusing to insure sick children, based on a loophole in ObamaCare.  But what do you expect when your legislation is drafted by Insurance & Pharma lobbyists??  Which would explain why Obama broke his promise to televise the healthcare negotiations on C-Span.

I am a democrat most of the time and I am disappointed by Obama. He is, I think in thrall to the military and to his financial advisors. But when I ask myself which party, democrat or republican, is more interested in the ordinary man, the working man not the managers, the answer is the democrats by a mile.

When I ask myself if I reduced my spending, laid off the several people who make my life easier- the housekeeper, the lawn service- and then kept my new found savings in the bank, would I be encouraging economic development, encouraging jobs, the answer is a resounding NO. After all, I had just taken jobs away from two people who would now be unemployed.

I even thought- what if I borrowed money and had some work done on my house. That would be a good decision- I have the money, my house needs some work on it, I am employing several people to do it. And I can pay the bank later with some of my savings and my improving job circumstances.

Hey! I am a little stimulus and all of these are reasons I will vote democratic
For the world's people! We must change. Yes, we can!

Truth is they are clueless, and have just about run our country into the ground.  Obama is an egotistical rank amateur who has no idea how to run our country.. His only expertise is knowing how to use a teleprompter, which only helps to cement his aloof and lack of soul character. Without it he is totally lost. 2 November will chill him and his cronies to the bone.

Please, please Barry, do your African rain dance and make uncompetitive, uneducated Americans competitive again.

The inevitable, which should have happened a decade ago, but which was was masked by a stock market, housing bubble, wars, and debt bubbles, is that "supply-side" economics has absolutely ruined this country.

You don't need a Harvard degree to figure out the legacy of this country since 1980 has been myopic over-consumption policies, banking cartels, and corporate greed.

It all starts with the children. Have you seen the kids of today???

Since Republican billionaires control the economy, not the President, can we maybe blame them? They want everything for themselves, but also don't want the general population to have anything. This feeds their arrogance in enjoying their money while depriving most others. Just like in France before their revolution.

Obama in throwing all his chips on passing a health care bill in his first year forgot the difference between important and urgent.  A tanking economy hemmoraging jobs was extremely urgent and important.  Passing a health care bill may be important, but was definitely NOT urgent.  The net result is a watered down health insurance initiative most of which will not take effect until 2014, plus millions of Americans losing their jobs AND health insurance NOW!

Is this a plea to the voters to be understanding of the administration's ineptitude.  Sure health care as passed looks great to some but it really isn't what the public was asking for, a public option.  Still the POTUS tried for bi-partisan support but when it evidently wasn't coming why didn't he go on the offensive and attack those who only offered no and refused to offer their own solution.  Whatever happens on November 2 will not change the rut the country is in.  It's clear that the Democrats lost their way both at the executive and congressional level.  It's equally clear that the Republicans will make gains and achieve nothing for either the struggling middle class or the unemployed.  A plague on all their houses!
I'm confused, where did he succeed?  Maybe his golf score improved from so much golf.  How is 5 more trillion in debt for the US treated as success?

I just got thru reading my new copy of Fortune a article in there by Allan sloan and Tory Newmyer titled What Washington isn,t telling Us About The Economy states the fact that there are no rabbits to pull out of the hat ,and no quick fixes ,it will take years to get the economy healty again ,no tax cuts no stimulas no Fed intervention,americans lived on borrowed money and above there means for to many years .read the article november issue Fortune.

"President Reagan managed to handle the inflation of Carter's Presidency."
WFB (comment 8)

Just a few minor errors. First it was not the "inflation Carter's Presidency. High inflation began before Carter took office (remember Ford" WIN (whip inflation now) buttons?) Second, Reagan had nothing to do with it. In fact, his policies created the biggest deficits in American history outside of war and were thus inflationary by any counter-cyclical theory. It was the Fed that stopped inflation by driving interest rates so high the economy crashed and we went through the worst recession from the Great Depression until that time. In the 1982 midterms the Republicans lose many House big and Reagan's approval rating was lower that Obama's is now. That might put a different perspective on what is happening today.

The real problem of the United States is not economic, it is political. Our government is dysfunctional. We love to brag about our separation of powers system and how it represents genius, but it is the antiquated product of 18th century Enlightenment thinking and makes governing the country impossible. Obama cannot command a majority in Congress because members are controlled by local interests and concerns. The "filibuster-proof majority" argument assumes that the 60 Democrats would vote in lock-step for whatever Obama proposed. In the American system, when you get to that large of a majority you will have some members who come from states that are much friendly to the other party and those individuals will demand many compromises to go along. Bargaining with them inevitably means watering down whatever is proposed. Even worse our "democratic" system has a legislative body in which 41 votes beats 59 votes. Nothing of real substance can be achieved. It is all watered down weak compromise or nothing. In Great Britain the government proposed decisive new policies and they will get them. I am not saying I agree with their policies but there will be a direction set and policies enacted and the people will be able to judge the results and decide who to reward and who to punish. We cannot even agree on who is to blame because no one commands the government and no one will command the government after next Tuesday.

As Jim Cramer of CNBC is fond of saying: "they know nothing" and that my leftist friends is everything you need to know about Obama and his economic team, or should I say his former economic team.

Obama is a disaster of the first magnitude as president and I'm very concerned how this guy is going to react to a Congress that isn't controlled by his party.

His ego is so large that compromise with a Republican House to better the economy and most importantly provide for an atmosphere conducive to job growth is in doubt.

As far as his successes are concerned they exist only in the halls of the NY Times.

Last month the stats said the net gain in private sector jobs was overwhelmed by the jobs lost in the government sector. How could that be? The Stimulus IS creating jobs, as promised. Yet overall losses continue.

Governments at all levels are cutting back staffing due to budget shortfalls. Why are they starving? Could it be Grover Nordquist is finally getting what he wants? To kill the “Beast” by denying it funding through Tax Cuts, Tax Cuts and more Tax Cuts, foisted on us by the Neo-Con conspiracy. That we have a two-pronged recession, one in the public sector, the other in governance strongly supports two different basic causes. We know a major cause of the public sector was the destruction wrought on our financial system by years of unrestrained Free Market ideology and the subsequent scams and looting. Our Government ails from the double whammy of unrestrained spending on war, the military and paybacks to donors and their corporations combined with decreased income due to Tax Cuts.

The Stimulus is working, creating jobs and increasing profits. It’s just not reaching Government. So it’s time for a Stimulus that helps Government create and maintain employment as well. A triple pronged approach ought to do it: cut wasteful spending for wars and military, increase spending for long term improvements such as education and public works (i.e. infrastructure) and restore taxes to levels that support that spending.

We were in a recession long before Bush/Cheney/Rove left office, caused by their policies and decisions. Recovery will be much quicker, the measures required less costly, if we first reverse their actions.

Obama's successes?

Bwaahahahahahaaaaaa.....I can't stop....please.... hahahahaaaaaaaa

Where? Foreign policy? Financial reform? Growth? Housing? Wars? Taxation? Name one success before you pluralize it NY Times.

Your bias is appalling. Just pure propaganda a week before the elections.

The following are proposed for the United States: (1)slash all spending for the silly foolishness in Iraq and Afghanistan immediately; (2)cut all foreign aid by 65% to any and all countries; (3)cut defense spending by 50%; (4)prosecute any person who engages in fraud or waste; (5)take away all tax incentives or breaks for corporations who take jobs overseas; (6)increase capital gains taxes by 15%; (7)fund education adequately and equitably; (9)impose sanctions on drug manufactures; (10)take on a serious effort to do something about the deterioating infrastructure in our society; (11)nationalise the National Guard to get rid of all gangs wherever they might be, and a host of other rational measures to benefit Americans!!!

The Obama team still lacks a fundamental understanding of how the economy works, and what stimulates both consumers and businesses to spend, and for the latter to expand and hire more workers. The answer is simple. When the government takes away less of the income of both consumers and businesses, consumers have more money to spend, sales increase at the retail level; businesses have more to spends, sales increase at the business to business level. As demand increases at both the consumer and business level, businesses act to meet that demand with more product, more production and more workers.

The problem is that the simplicity of the idea of reducing taxes to increase buying and demand, as with more people working earning more money, with more businesses making more money, the tax revenues rather than declining actually increase the fastest when the economy is naturally stimulated by putting more money into the hands of Americans, no strings attached. We have seen over and over again that the tendency of the liberals to try to micromanage the economy provides nothing more than short term blips that rapidly evaporate as soon as the targeted stimulus dollars dry up.

The American people are going to give the Democrats their report card at the beginning of next month.
